channel.title: Ask the Experts on Loans101
channel.description: Recent content in Ask the Experts on Loans101

item.title: I am currently looking to buy a property soon. Looking at the prices within the area, not certain if we will be able to put our foot in back into the game. We have some savings but may not be enough to cover 20% and the stamp duty of an average AUD1.2 million priced property within the surrounds. i am in the highest tax bracket but my partner is currently working as a casual. Will I be able to use our combined earnings to get a housing loan?
item.description: Hi Ampie - lender can use casual income from 3 months - with other taking 6-12-24. If you are looking for your own home, you can borrow to 95% + 2-4% of the costs. LMI is payable > 80% and it saves if you have the deposit - but not mandatory - if you can service the loan. for a $1.2M purchase at 90% you would require $203k deposit (inc stamp duty etc) or at 95% $179k - and if you can service the loan we can add 2-4% of the costs (depending on lender).

item.title: I am seeking a broker that I can meet to discuss my home loan refinance. I live in South Coogee and work in Macquarie Park. My home loan is $1.1M and home is worth $3.5M. I also have an investment property in Brisbane that I am selling. The loan on this property is $560k but the property will only sell for around $470k. However, I can offset the loss against a capital gain I have to pay in this tax year. I also would like a $100k Line of Credit facility as part of loan refinance.
item.description: Hi Donald - Its a pity about the Qld property - brokers dont want to see this when people are investing their hard earnt money. Line of credit start from 4.47% - with offset starting from 3.68%. Multiple lenders depending on other features and income servicing.

item.title: If my wife is working as casual from last 10 months then how much % of her income is countable towards landing mortgage? and how long does it takes to get the preapproved home loan?
item.description: There are numerous lenders who will accept 100% of your wife income. Turn around times for a pre-approval (depending on the lender) are anywhere from 24-72 hours. Feel free to contact me via my profile if you’d like more info.

item.title: Just wondering as it comes up with.... No deals with bad credit. Do you not help people with bad credit, to get a home loan?
item.description: We are happy to help people with bad credit. There are definitely lenders in the non conforming space who specialise in this area. The loan product and interest rates will depend on the type of “bad credit”, such as missed repayments, defaults or a high number credit enquiries. Based on this, we can match the most appropriate lender to your situation.

item.title: Can i get a home loan with a low repayments and probably 5% down payment only?
item.description: You most definitely can obtain a home loan with 5% deposit, provided that you can also service the loan. Ensure you have sufficient funds for stamp duty, and related fees. If you would like some guidance around this, please click on my profile and contact me.

item.title: I am interested in seeking the best competitive investment loan for my situation which is I have 3 investment properties and total outstanding is about $500K . Currently, I am on P&I payments with one of the major banks. I am also keen to see if there are competitive interest only loans for my situation.
item.description: Special investment rates for P&I, must be under 80% LVR: 3.74% for 2 year fixed 3.79% for 3 year fixed and variable starting from 3.99% Naturally, properties need to be acceptable security and serviceability needs to be met.

item.title: Looking to buy another home but the banks are very tight on equity.
item.description: It is difficult at the moment with unsure values of properties and different banks treating the same property very differently. As a broker that is what we trained to do, take the running around off you and make the process more user friendly. To assist you, I would need to know some more detailed information. My contact details are in my profile, and i would be happy to assist you in working through the information to see if we can find you a solution.

item.title: My partner & I have 7 properties, 1 being principal address and 6 investments. The properties in total are worth around $2.4million with a mortgage of $570k , which is split over 2 investment properties. I am 46 and partner is 69 . I live off my investments as I am retired and my partner works part time earning around $26k a year. The rental income is $2085pw repayment is $1969 for one investment and the other $1083 for the other. I have $226k in super and partner around $12k. My exit strategy is when I am 68 and would like to continue to invest. In my own name I would like to borrow for 1 investment and would like to know how much I can borrow and if possible to borrow.
item.description: Thank you for your enquiry, and also the extra information you have provided. A number of factors would need to be discussed to aid you in your investment enquiries, to ensure that you not only are able to proceed with your investment strategy, but also that we are able to structure the acquisition to provide you ongoing protection for you and your assets. I am sure that I can help you in regards to your future investment strategies.

item.title: We are currently looking to refinance our home loan We hace 2 loans with bankwest one for our land and one for our house. The house is on the land. The value of our house is 650000 we currently owe 390000 aprox. We are looking for a loan of 415000 because we want to do aditions to the property. We are looking for a 5 yr fixed interest loan with a offset account . And no ongoing fees over 25 yrs.
item.description: Based on the information you have provided there are a number of options that suit the criteria you have listed above. For a 5 year fixed rate with an offset account you could be looking at interest rates of about 4.19% right through to 4.79%. Some of these banks offer 100% offset accounts on their fixed rate loans and some will offer a shaded offset account, say around 50% to 70% offset.

item.title: We were in the middle of saving for a deposit and a block of land has become available. we have $24000 in savings and a further $25000 as a gift. the property is $495000. if we want to put a deposit down on the block can we access this from the loan ? we are also very anxious how long is the process of approval before we would be able to make an offer?
item.description: Great Question - You have the 5% genuine savings for the land and Im wondering if the gift has been in your account for > 3 months - if so then this might make up the balance of the house and land 5% needed. If you are looking to build asap - the rent or board you are currently paying is not included in servicing if both loans are put in at the same time.

item.title: Just wondering if you can get a loan for someone on 820 visa?
item.description: You can providing your partner has Australian Citizenship and you have proof of your relationship. Loan will be restricted to 80% of property purchase. Let me know if I can help.

item.title: Looking for an investment property loan
item.description: Happy to assist. There are many variables at the moment when it comes to investment lending e.g. interest only versus principal + interest, how much deposit you have . Just a couple of things that will impact the interest rate as all lenders have different requirements. Contact me through my profile and we can chat then.

item.title: We have an existing loan would like to refinance to incorporate credit card debt. We are both retired and on pension. Our exsisting variable rate is over 30years. Would there be another lender /better rates than we have now. $75,0000 @ 4.45%.
item.description: Depending on your pensions - there are rates from 3.67% for refinance with cash out for debt consolidation. Would love to help you. Please contact me via my Profile Page. I look forward to hearing from you.

item.title: I am looking at buying a block of land and subdividing into 2. Cost of subdivision will be about $10,000. Land will be $95-100k. The land will be worth about $80k per block once divided. I am looking at building 2 house ( 1 on each block ) which will cone in around $200k per house. Once complet the houses will be worth about $360k each. Interested in a loan that gives me maximum leverage as I have another house I am going to start in before this. I owe about $97000k on the land which is valued by ANZ at $160k. The house build will be $330k whilst an agent has valued the finished home at $580k-$630k
item.description: We can certainly assist in this type of project. Of course, the amount you can borrow will depend on your current financial position and the structure of ownership of these properties. You may also need to consider the taxation implications when subdividing blocks. Would love to have a chat to you about your situation so feel free to contact me through my profile.

item.title: I am planning to buy land from a developer estate and then get a separate builder to construct the house. My plan is to start building as soon as the land gets titled. I am wondering which loans I can apply for. I am looking for a good rate.
item.description: This type of purchase would fall under a construction loan and is usually financed in two steps: buying the land then building the house. The loans can be arranged separately, but are generally bundled together for approval. The purchase of the land occurs as a standard mortgage. Then the building of the house operates as a construction loan where you can draw-down on an agreed amount to pay for each stage.

item.title: I'm buying a off the plan apartment through my SMSF. Purchase price is 600K. ( plus stamp etc) I've put in 10% and anticipate completion in early 2018 ( maybe Feb) I'm told the apartment has already increases approx 25% in value I want to know what loans are available to SMSF's
item.description: Assuming your transaction has been structured appropriately (bare trust considerations), there are many factors (some below) to consider with SMSF lending. There are a limited number of options offering up to 80% LVR meaning that your SMSF will need to contribute funds representing at least 20% of the valuation on completion, which in itself could pose a problem as valuations may come in less than contract price. There may also be liquidity requirements meaning that the SMSF must have sufficient cash assets (post-completion) as a buffer.

item.title: I am a current home owner and I am looking for a $10000 personal loan for home improvements.I don't have enough equity in my home that's why I need a personal loan.Could you please advise what lender would do personal loans and how quickly can a personal loan be approved by.I need the loan urgently.
item.description: There are numerous lenders that can provide unsecured finance within 24-48 hours. I would suggest that you are best to book an appointment with a broker to undertake a review of your financial circumstances. You may have more options available to you than you are currently aware of, including unlocking equity from your home with an up-to-date valuation, consolidating debt and accessing existing lines of credit, along with many other options that include exploring the wide variety of competitive personal loan products on the market.

item.title: I am a current home owner with a mortgage of $202,000. I am looking at re-financing my mortgage with lower repayments but would also like to burrow extra for minor house renovations. I don't have any other loans. I currently have a personal credit card with the credit limit of $9,000 (at the moment, my credit card debt is $500 as I don't really like using it unless it is for emergencies). I would like a loan that allows me to make extra repayments and have the ability to redraw if needed. I have been in my current job for 11months (started Oct 16) but can provide all necessary past financial documents if required. Please advise what the best option might be.
item.description: We would be very happy to assist you with refinancing to reduce your repayments and at the same access some equity for some home improvements. As a general rule of thumb, if you have had your current loan for more than 2 years, then it is likely that you will be able to refinance at a better rate and access some loan features such as a line of credit and a redraw facility.

item.title: Looking for a construction loan of approx. $310,000, have a block of land and owe approx. $130,000 on that with CBA and have a small personal loan of$ 29,000 also with CBA , my partner and I earn approx. $110,000 per year combined now the tricky thing is at the moment my partner is a undischarged bankrupt and wont be discharged until may next year. Are there any options out there for our circumstances or are we royally stuffed?
item.description: Your lending options are unfortunately limited with a co-borrower that has an undischarged bankruptcy. You really require the assistance of a broker who specialises in credit impaired finance. Not all brokers are specialists in this area so choose someone who declares this speciality, particularly if your loan requirements are time sensitive. Good luck and I hope you achieve your dream home ownership!

item.title: I am interested in a home & land package for 460,000 and can put in 40,000 deposit. So looking for 420,000 home loan. Gross Annual Income 84,000. First Time Home Buyer with no debts/no credit cards/no other loans. Two Dependents (Wife and Infant). Can I afford this property considering my borrowing power and Can I get less than 4.0% home loan interest rate?
item.description: It sounds to me like you need a review of your financial circumstances to not only understand your borrowing power, but to also understand if a loan of this size will place you under financial distress. With 2 dependants, one being an infant, it is extremely important that you understand what loan amount you can afford, not necessary just what loan you can qualify for. With the Loan Value Ratio (LVR) you are looking at, you will likely be subject to Lenders Mortgage Insurance (LMI) which will add to the total cost of your loan.

item.title: I am looking at a block of flats to buy 4 of them. Is there a way that the seller can provide the deposit for example if the price is $270,000 have a price of $295,000 on the contract and him put up the $25k. Or any other way without him putting up the $25k upfront?
item.description: Are you saying you don’t want to put in a deposit or you don’t actually have any funds to put towards a deposit? Any lender is going to want to see that you have funds to complete the purchase, a deposit bond can assist if you don’t have access to the funds right now but will have the funds prior to settlement, e.g using equity from another property via refinance/equity release.

item.title: I'm looking to buy my first home in the next few months, I will have a 5% deposit and earn around $115,000pa and 1 dependent. The problem is I have a default on my credit history (I feel its on there by mistake) If this can't be removed will that stop me from buying a property? The amount listed was for $395
item.description: Firstly, congratulations on embarking on the home loan journey. It is a very exciting time but I understand that issue of a default can be stressful. A small default like you describe won’t necessarily stop you from getting a home loan approved, but there are things you can do to resolve it - as it is better to go in with a clean slate. Creditors will remove defaults if you can demonstrate they are wrong or you can make arrangements with them to pay it off.

item.title: I have a home loan with CBA but I am not on the title - my mother is on the title as well as the loan. She is a pensioner and I have always been paying the loan. I am finding it quite difficult to refinance as all banks need me to be on the title. I don't want to be on the title - just want to refinance - are there any lenders that would help me?
item.description: This is indeed possible if you are happy to go jointly on the loan with your mother. You can still remain off the title. Unfortunately, there is no other way you will be able to refinance for her if you remain off the loan. Feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

item.title: I am 54, earn a reasonable income ($120k) per annum and my wife is 39 and earns under $50k, we have 5 kids and carry a bit of credit card debt, it's hard to save any money for a deposit, are there any no deposit products in the market these days? if not no deposit perhaps low deposit like 2% as they have in WA?
item.description: You’re a busy man I see with 5 kids so good on you. Just to answer your question, it’s possible but you will need a really clean credit history as any loan you might take out will have to be approved by a Mortgage Insurer even after the lender says they will look at it. If you have a good rental payment history that helps and can be counted as genuine savings with certain lenders.

item.title: Are there any banks that would be happy with the last 6 months of financials rather than just looking at the previous financial year as a whole?
item.description: There are only a couple of lenders that will accept 6 months history. No bank will look at last 6 months. They need minimum 16 & 17 financials. I will need more information on your situation to comment any further.

item.title: Current owner occupied home valued at $3.2M. Loan size $1.4M with 100% offset @ 3.71%. I have $700k in an offset account. 1. Is there a better rate home loan for my owner occupied home? 2. Is there possibility of borrowing more money for an investment property (with some of the deposits to be used from the offset account)? My salary income is $250k base a year. Wife not working. 1 dependant child.
item.description: You currently have a competitive rate on your home loan and you can certainly look to utilising the equity you have built up through your offset account and capital appreciation to invest in an investment property. I am a financial planner as well as being a mortgage broker located on the North Shore of Sydney. The strategies and structures are the key to you maximising your resources and I am happy to assist if you would like to contact me.

item.title: I've seen under some details that you can use the equity under a family members home to reduce LMI - can you use equity in property owned overseas in the UK
item.description: Equity in an international asset is not acceptable security for Australian lenders. However, another effective means of freeing up funds to reduce or eliminate LMI is a ground approach to your overall financial situation. By taking a wholistic approach to your financial requirements and delving deeper into your circumstances, we can ensure that all facets of your financial situation are performing optimally. If you are servicing debts such as cars, credit cards, personal loans that affect your ability to save effectively and efficiently, a simple financial health check could provide you with the means to better service your loan, save a greater deposit and place you in better overall financial position prior to applying for a home loan.

item.title: I would like to buy an investment property via a family trust structure. I will be the main person with borrowing capacity(20-30% deposit ready) and want to add two adult beneficiaries ( Parents )as well to the structure with no borrowing capacity .What are the loan options available and the rates in specific in your response kindly?I like to hear from someone servicing around Melbourne if possible in family trust loans for investment property
item.description: I assume that you are operating under the professional advice of your accountant or lawyer given you are looking to structure your loan under a trust. You most certainly need the assistance of a broker who can effectively liaise with your accountant or lawyer to ascertain the most appropriate product for your specific needs, goals and circumstances. Most brokers can secure you a competitive interest rate on your loan, however I suggest you find one that will delve a little deeper into your situation to ensure you are recommended a loan that provides you with the best value rather the lowest rate.

item.title: I am looking for the best deal for an investment loan. I have one residential property and one investment property at present. I would like to be contacted with the best deal for my situation.
item.description: The right investment home loan really depends on your particular financial goals. There are many different borrowing options and strategies available. Your investment loan should match your long-term financial goals and your broker should focus on maximising your borrowing power to achieve your investment goals faster. Most brokers can secure you a competitive interest rate on your loan, however I suggest you find one that will delve a little deeper into your situation to ensure you are recommended a loan that provides you with the best value rather than just the lowest rate.

item.title: Looking for a home loan for approx $500K. Earning good income and have an accountant's letter to confirm income. Is there a home loan product available?
item.description: Most Lo Doc are maxed out at 80% - indicative rates 5.59% secured by owner occupied property and 5.59% investment. There are 90% loans - would be 6.5% +. Your accountant would need to sign off on the required income. For example -= to service requires income $80k if your single and with no other loans or credit cards - $86k with $10k credit card. Can work out specifics with more details.

item.title: I currently have a residential home loan to the value of $500 000. We are currently looking at refinancing as our lender will not extend the interest only period of our loan. Current value of the property is in the order of $580 - $600k. We have had trouble refinancing as the serviceability calculator takes into account debt on principal & Interest payments at a rate of %7.25. When our current debt repayments are interest only repayments at %4.19.
item.description: I am guessing that your situation has changed since you first took out the loan. Unfortunately I think you are going to struggle to refinance if you are not able to service the debt according the lenders calculators. As part of responsible lending obligations both mortgage brokers and lenders need to ensure that you can manage repayments should interest rates rise. This is why we use higher rates in the lenders calculators.

item.title: I am a first home buyer. I run my own business (freight truck driver) I clear $1000 per week after taxes. I have $50,000 saved for a deposit and am wondering how big of a home loan I would be able to get or any assistance.
item.description: Great to see you have saved a significant deposit. The amount you can borrow is determined by your income and debt levels. As a first home buyer, you may also be eligible for First Home Owners Grant and exemptions from some government fees and charges. Being self-employed most lenders will require at least 2 years business financials. Would love to talk to you to gain a better understanding of your overall position and see how we can help you get into your own home.

item.title: I need to refinance for land. Loan for $315k, value $650k. In a family trust name. However, highly possible the loan will be paid out in the next few months as we hope to sell it. I am aware we will have penalty fees.
item.description: Why not consider private funding or the like, it’s a little more expensive, but very quick and very easy. No exit fees and the interest is prepaid with the loan proceeds. I hope that this helps.

item.title: My partner (plus her mum, government job $62,000, her house valued at $500,000 and has $35,000 to pay plus $100,000 inheritance coming) and myself need to buy out her ex husbands share of the existing loan. The house was valued at $850,000 and we need to get approval for $500,000. We already had gotten a pre-approval from RAMS but that was based on the fact I was on Newstart allowance and has now run out. Myself and my partner are now both on Carers payment and allowance and I know RAMS didn't recognise this as income. Who does recognise carers payments? and would approve this.
item.description: There may be ways to work around the servicing of this issue. Primarily speaking there are lenders that look at carer’s allowance depending on the nature of it. Secondarily, it would be worthwhile to adjust perhaps your living situation for now if possible so that at least one of the properties can be used as an investment/rental. Let me know if you wish to explore this properly!

item.title: I am self employed, my partner works full time. Can we refinance to consolidate or credit card debt and personal loan ?? We are both 56 years of age and have a decent amount of equity in the house ??
item.description: Thanks for your question. Providing you have sufficient equity in your property, then you should be able to consolidate your unsecured debt into the home loan. Some lenders may restrict the loan term once you are above the age of 55 but others are a little more flexible in regards to this, particularly if you can show a clear exit strategy. Being self employed, you have various options open to you such as low doc, one year business financials or the last two years of business financials.

item.title: 1.what are requirements for showing genuine savings when the loan is being processed For a first home buyer having 10 percent deposit .Also how long does the statement of savings needs to be 2. Also I had a bad experience where in I had put an offer but the bank valuation came in lower than the contract price .What options do i have in that regard.
item.description: With a 10% deposit you dont need genuine savings at all. However if you have to go above 90% then there are other options available, such as rental payments etc. With regards to valuation - did you go to a bank direct - because brokers have access to various panel valuers and could easily get a second valuation or challenge the low valuation by way of additional documentation like comparable sales etc.

item.title: I am an Australian Citizen and my husband has just applied for his permanent residency based on 820/801 spouse visa. Currently he is on a Bridging Visa A that will take him towards the 820 visa [in a couple of months] and then the 801. We would like to apply for a home loan with 5% deposit if we can as we would like to start building a new home shortly. It will also be our first home and we do qualify for FHOG. Would it be possible to secure a home loan?
item.description: As Ditte has suggested you can get a loan but we will need more detail to confirm the amount. I have done a very similar one recently and the question is not just whether the Bank will accept your husband as a borrower but also if they will accept his income. At 95% loan there are not too many that do but some will. I am more than happy to go over this with you and explain your options.

item.title: Just wanting to know our options about the possibility of getting a home loan.
item.description: What you would need to provide would be your Income - Expenses - Deposit (Equity or Family Guarantee). Income (all people who are borrowing) and details of what it is - salary - commission - family benefits etc. Expenses includes credit card limits, personal loans, car loans, HECS debt. Deposit - savings or any current property - any family member who can guarantee security so you dont need to save for a deposit.

item.title: Is it possible to use the FHOG to help make up a deposit or should I save more? Any advice on the following stats would be welcome. STATS: Couple - stable combined income 200K - 250K, debt (car/cards - currently being paid off fast) 40K, excellent credit history. Only a low deposit saved of 10K.
item.description: Generally lenders will require 5% of the total contract/purchase price as genuine savings. This means that it would need to be tracked back at least 3 months with a regular pattern rather than erratic lump sums. There are a few lenders who will accept rental history in leau of savings but the rental contract must be via a licensed real estate agent. The FHOG is not counted as genuine savings by lenders but is used at the drawdown of the construction loan to assist with the total cost.

item.title: We are looking to refinance to consolidate and release equity. Upon applying we discovered my partner has a paid default -credit card $3000 from @3 years ago and had been late on some recent payments in last 6 months on current cards but up to date and not on credit record. We have been approved by one of the big4 for our home loan and credit cards but not the extra we wanted with sub 3.9% rate . Property @$650,000 value - current loan $225k and @$22 on cards want to release $75k approx for improvements and another purpose.
item.description: We have a number of lenders that will consider your application and cash out requirements. Rates from 3.74% subject to standard lender approval process. As part of our service, I will conduct a detailed review of your current situation and finance requirements to ensure the best possible solution is presented to you. Your decision to engage Clark Finance Group will not only maximise your results, but it will also give you the peace of mind of knowing we will find you the most competitive finance package that will meet your needs, and we will facilitate the process swiftly and professionally from start to finish.

item.title: I want to pay down my home loan as fast I can. Can a broker help me with a finance stratgey that involves in property investment ? I've read about people paying off their home in 5 years is this possible? Should I see financial planner or can broker help me with this? I own 430K dwelling owe 380K my wife and I have combined income of 110K.
item.description: We work closely with many of our clients to help them pay off their home in the fastest possible time, invest in property while minimizing taxation and growing their wealth for their family and their future. We have seen people pay their homes off in 5 -10 years but it does rely on numerous factors such as increasing capital growth rates, equity, discipline and particular loan structures and products. More than happy to take you through the process and develop an customised strategy for you.
